meanings.definition: the seven-day period of mourning in Judaism
meanings.sent1: During the shivahs, family and friends gather to support each other.
meanings.sent2: She observed the shivahs after her grandmother passed away.
meanings.sent3: The somber atmosphere during the shivahs was filled with memories of happier times.
meanings.sent4: The shivahs felt like a never-ending cycle of sorrow and remembrance.
meanings.sent5: The shivahs were a time to honor and remember the life of the departed loved one.

meanings.definition: plural form of shivah, meaning a traditional Jewish mourning ritual
meanings.sent1: The family followed the customs of the shivahs to honor their ancestors.
meanings.sent2: Many people attended the shivahs to pay their respects.
meanings.sent3: The shivahs brought the community together in a solemn gathering.
meanings.sent4: The shivahs were a time to reflect on the lives of those who had passed.
meanings.sent5: The shivahs were a meaningful tradition that connected generations in remembrance.

meanings.definition: a period of intense grief or mourning
meanings.sent1: Her heart was heavy with sorrow during the shivahs.
meanings.sent2: The shivahs were a time of deep reflection and mourning.
meanings.sent3: Despite the sadness, the shivahs brought a sense of closure.
meanings.sent4: The shivahs felt like a storm of emotions crashing down.
meanings.sent5: The shivahs were a time to process and heal from the loss.
